Note.text: If you'd like specialized in-person help, San Mateo County offers in-person help for restraining orders Mondays from 8am to 12 noon and 1:30 to 3pm at the Self-Help office on the 6th floor

CH0.text: What do you need help with?

CH1.text: Ask for a new civil harassment restraining order

CHCheck1.text: Do you want protection from someone who has harassed you? (Harassment can be stalking, threats, or repeated unwanted contact)

CHCheck2.text: Are they someone you: are NOT related to, have NOT dated, and are NOT married to? (Like neighbors, coworkers, or strangers)

CHStart.text: You may qualify for a Civil Harassment Restraining Order

CHTiming.text: Note: Civil Harassment Restraining Orders typically take 1-2 weeks to process. You may be able to get a temporary order the same day if there's immediate danger.

CHMinor.text: If you're under 12, a trusted adult must help you file. Please contact the Self-Help Center in-person or online via LiveChat for assistance.

CHAlt.text: You may qualify for a different restraining order: Domestic Violence, Elder Abuse, or Workplace Violence

CHNotQual.text: A restraining order is only available if there has been harassment. You may want to speak to a legal aid provider about other options.

CHForms.text: To start a Civil Harassment Restraining Order (CHRO), fill out required forms

CH100a.text: Step 1: Fill out CH-100 (Request for Civil Harassment Restraining Order)

CH100b.text: In CH-100, describe the harassment in detail. Include dates, times, and what happened. Be specific about how it affected you.

CH100c.text: Step 2: Fill out CLETS-001 (Confidential Law Enforcement Information). This helps police enforce the order.

CH109a.text: Step 3: Fill out CH-109 (Notice of Court Hearing). This tells the other person about the hearing.

CH110a.text: Step 4: Fill out CH-110 (Civil Harassment Restraining Order). This is the actual order if granted.

CM010a.text: Step 5: Fill out CM-010 (Confidential Information Form). This contains sensitive information.

CHReview.text: Review all forms for completeness and accuracy. Make sure all information is correct.

CHOptional.text: Optional: If you have evidence (texts, emails, photos, videos), make copies to attach to your forms.

CHPickup.text: Pick up your completed forms from the kiosk or print them if you're using the online system.

CHRead.text: Read through all forms one more time. Make sure you understand what you're filing.

CHCheckOrders.text: Do you want to ask for a temporary restraining order (TRO) that takes effect immediately?

CHTROYes.text: You can ask for a TRO. The judge will decide if you get immediate protection.

CHTRONo.text: You'll get a hearing date. The order won't take effect until after the hearing.

CHServePrep.text: After filing, you must serve the other person with copies of all forms.

ServeWho.text: Do you know someone 18 or older who can serve the papers for you?

SERStart.text: Service of Process - How to serve the other person

SER1.text: The person serving must be 18 or older and NOT involved in your case.

SER2.text: They can serve by: handing the papers directly to the person, or leaving them with someone 18+ at their home or work.

SER3.text: After serving, they must fill out a Proof of Service form and give it to you.

SERSoon.text: You must serve the other person at least 5 days before the hearing (or 15 days if they live out of state).

SERGather.text: Gather evidence for your hearing: photos, texts, emails, witness statements, police reports.

AltStart.text: You can hire a process server or ask the sheriff to serve the papers for a fee.

CH2.text: Respond to a civil harassment restraining order someone else filed

CH3.text: Change or end an existing civil harassment restraining order

CH5.text: Renew a civil harassment restraining order before it expires

CHCQ.text: Have a question about filling out the CH-100? View common questions here:

CHQ2.text: How much does it cost to file a CHRO?

CHQ3.text: Can I get a CHRO against my neighbor?

CHQ4.text: How long does a CHRO last?

CHQ6.text: Can I get a CHRO if I'm under 18?

CHQA.text: What if I don't remember the exact dates?

CHQA2.text: What if I need more space to describe the harassment?

CH100f.text: If you don't remember the exact date, estimate and explain (e.g., 'Around August 2020')

CH100d.text: If you need more space, attach MC-025 (Attachment Form) or use blank paper

CHProof1.text: If you have evidence (texts, emails, photos, videos), attach it to your request

CHFiling.text: File your forms with the court clerk. There is a filing fee unless you qualify for a fee waiver.

CHFeeWaiver.text: Do you need help paying the filing fee?

CHFeeWaiverYes.text: Ask the clerk for a fee waiver form (FW-001). You may qualify if you have low income.

CHFeeWaiverNo.text: Pay the filing fee. The clerk will give you a receipt and hearing date.

CHHearing.text: Attend your hearing. Bring all evidence and be prepared to explain why you need the restraining order.

CHOrder.text: If granted, the judge will sign the restraining order. Get copies for yourself and law enforcement.

CHServeOrder.text: Serve the signed order on the other person. File proof of service with the court.

CHViolation.text: If the other person violates the order, call 911 immediately. Keep records of all violations.

edges.when: Ask for a new civil harassment restraining order
Respond to a civil harassment restraining order
Change or end an existing order
Renew a civil harassment restraining order
